com.autonomy.aci.client.util

Class AciURLCodec

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.autonomy.aci.client.util.AciURLCodec

  • public final class AciURLCodec
extends Object
    Implements the 'www-form-urlencoded' encoding scheme, also misleadingly known as URL encoding.

    For more detailed information please refer to Chapter 17.13.4 'Form content types' of the HTML 4.01 Specification

    This codec differs from the spec as it encodes spaces as %20 and not as +. This is required by various IDOL Server components to stop references with spaces in them being treated as multiple references, as the space character is a valid ACI parameter value separator.

      • getInstance

        public static AciURLCodec getInstance()
        Returns the thread safe singleton instance of this class.
        Returns:
        The thread safe singleton instance of this class

      • encode

        public String encode(String string)
        Encodes a string into its URL safe form using the UTF-8 charset. Unsafe characters are escaped and the resulting string is returned in the US-ASCII charset.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to convert to a URL safe form
        Returns:
        URL safe string
        Throws:
        AciURLCodecException - If there was a problem during the encoding

      • decode

        public String decode(String string)
              throws AciURLCodecException
        Decodes a URL safe string into its original form using the UTF-8 charset. Escaped characters are converted back to their original representation.
        Parameters:
        string - URL safe string to convert into its original form
        Returns:
        original string
        Throws:
        AciURLCodecException - Thrown if URL decoding is unsuccessful
